column5: How about Watermelons. Can you take them to Canada?

I was told that you cannot bring potatoes into Canada from the US unless they are canned. This sounds ridiculous and if it's true I probably shouldn't have brought that 50lb bag with me this spring. Is there any truth to this or is somebody misinformed?

Some visitors have had their spuds confiscated at the border and others have been let thru. I had mine taken on July 18 at Rainy River and then drove a mile down the road and bought a bag that said grown in the USA. There has been a blight on spuds produced in certain US states but it seems the ban on importing them into Canada is inconsistently enforced.
Fishoil: This subject was addressed here in late June and references were provided for those interested in the official skinny. The link is:https://www.walleyecentral.com/dc/dcb...ng_type=search
Thanks for the link. I missed it in my search because I spelled potato with an "e" at the end. I never was much good at spelling.LOL
Hey Fishoil, I think you spelled it right!! Singular, it is Potato, but according to my spell check on Word, Plural it is Potatoes!!
